Name: Scarab with the name Amun-Re
Description: Finely carved, small blue-glazed steatite scarab, bearing on the underside the image of a broad collar, below the hieroglyphic writing of the name of Amun-Re. From the Middle Kingdom onwards, scarabs commonly served as amulets, often with the name of a god and among these the most popular was that of Amun, meaning 'the hidden one'. The quality of this miniature suggests a date in the 18th Dynasty.
